definitions: not predicted or expected beforehand; happening without warning or prior knowledge
examples: The unforeseen circumstances delayed the project considerably
An unforeseen problem emerged during the negotiations

definitions: so memorable, remarkable, or impressive that it cannot be forgotten
examples: Their wedding was an unforgettable celebration of love
She had an unforgettable voice that moved everyone

definitions: so bad, wrong, or offensive that it cannot be forgiven or excused
examples: His betrayal was an unforgivable breach of trust
She considered lying to be an unforgivable sin

definitions: unwilling or unable to forgive people's mistakes or wrongdoings
allowing no room for error; harsh and demanding in nature
examples: He remained unforgiving toward those who betrayed him
The unforgiving judge sentenced him to maximum penalty
The unforgiving desert climate challenged even experienced travelers
This unforgiving sport demands absolute physical perfection

definitions: having or marked by bad luck or unfavorable circumstances
causing disappointment or regret; unsuitable or inappropriate
examples: The unfortunate accident left three people injured
He was unfortunate enough to lose his job
His unfortunate choice of words offended many people
It was unfortunate timing for such an announcement

definitions: having no foundation in fact; not based on evidence or reason
examples: The rumors about the merger proved completely unfounded
Their unfounded accusations damaged his reputation severely

definitions: not kind, warm, or pleasant in manner; showing hostility
difficult or unpleasant to use or deal with
examples: The unfriendly receptionist barely acknowledged our presence
Their unfriendly neighbors never returned our greetings
The software has an unfriendly interface for beginners
This unfriendly climate discourages outdoor activities

definitions: not having achieved satisfaction or one's potential in life
not carried out, completed, or satisfied as required
examples: She felt unfulfilled in her current career path
His unfulfilled dreams haunted him for years
The unfulfilled orders caused customer complaints
Several unfulfilled promises damaged their credibility

definitions: not provided with money or financial resources; lacking funding
examples: The unfunded research project was eventually canceled
Many unfunded mandates burden local governments significantly

definitions: failing to be amusing or entertaining; lacking humor
examples: His unfunny jokes made everyone uncomfortable
The supposedly comic movie was painfully unfunny

definitions: moving in an awkward, clumsy way; lacking grace or elegance
examples: The ungainly teenager stumbled across the dance floor
His ungainly gait made him easily recognizable

definitions: not conforming to the rules of grammar; containing grammatical errors
examples: The ungrammatical sentence confused the readers completely
His ungrammatical speech revealed his limited education

definitions: not feeling or showing gratitude or thanks for kindness received
examples: The ungrateful child never thanked his parents
She felt hurt by his ungrateful response

definitions: not protected or watched over; lacking defense or protection
said or done without careful thought; revealing more than intended
examples: The unguarded entrance allowed intruders easy access
They left the valuables unguarded during lunch
In an unguarded moment, she revealed the secret
His unguarded comments caused considerable controversy

definitions: lacking direction, supervision, or guidance; proceeding without leadership
examples: The unguided tour allowed visitors to explore freely
Their unguided attempts resulted in numerous mistakes

definitions: feeling or showing sadness, discontent, or misery
causing misfortune or trouble; inappropriate or unsuitable
examples: The unhappy child cried throughout the journey
She felt unhappy about the decision
It was an unhappy coincidence that they arrived together
The unhappy wording of the contract caused disputes

definitions: not hurt or damaged; remaining safe and without injury
examples: The hostages were released unharmed after negotiations
Miraculously, everyone escaped the accident unharmed

definitions: in poor health; showing signs of illness or poor condition
likely to cause illness or poor health; not beneficial
examples: The unhealthy patient required immediate medical attention
Her unhealthy appearance worried her friends
Their unhealthy diet consisted mainly of processed foods
The unhealthy working conditions violated safety standards

definitions: not heard or listened to; ignored or unnoticed
not known before; unprecedented or extremely rare
examples: Her pleas for help went unheard
The unheard testimony could have changed the verdict
Such generosity was previously unheard of
These unheard of prices shocked customers

definitions: not providing assistance or useful service; failing to be helpful
examples: The unhelpful staff ignored our questions completely
His unhelpful comments only made matters worse

definitions: not previously announced or expected; happening without fanfare or recognition
examples: The team's unheralded rookie became their star player
Her unheralded arrival surprised everyone at the meeting

definitions: not slowed, blocked, or interfered with; able to proceed freely
examples: The project continued unhindered despite budget concerns
Traffic flowed unhindered through the new tunnel

definitions: mentally unbalanced or deranged; showing extreme emotional instability
removed or detached from hinges; not attached properly
examples: His unhinged behavior frightened everyone around him
The unhinged rant went viral on social media
The storm left several doors unhinged
The unhinged gate swung wildly in the wind

definitions: contrary to religious law or teaching; wicked or sinful
shocking, dreadful, or unreasonable in degree or nature
examples: Their unholy alliance shocked the religious community
The unholy ritual violated sacred traditions
They made an unholy mess of the kitchen
The unholy noise woke the entire neighborhood

definitions: not harmed or injured physically; escaping without injury
examples: She emerged unhurt from the car accident
The child remained unhurt despite the fall

definitions: impossible to identify or recognize; lacking distinguishing features or marks
examples: The badly decomposed remains were unidentifiable
An unidentifiable substance contaminated the water supply

definitions: not recognized or identified; of unknown identity or origin
examples: Police found an unidentified body in the river
An unidentified flying object appeared on radar

definitions: joined together to form a single unit or coherent whole
examples: The unified team worked toward common goals
A unified approach solved the complex problem

definitions: remaining the same in all cases and at all times
not varying in form, manner, or degree; consistent throughout
examples: The uniform temperature ensured optimal growing conditions
They maintained uniform quality across all products
The uniform distribution of resources prevented conflicts
A uniform coating covered the entire surface

definitions: dressed in a uniform, especially as part of official duties
examples: Uniformed officers patrolled the streets throughout the night
The uniformed guards checked everyone's identification

definitions: serving to unite or bring together different elements into one
examples: Music served as a unifying force for the community
The unifying theme connected all the stories

definitions: performed by or affecting only one side, party, or faction
examples: The country's unilateral withdrawal surprised its allies
His unilateral decision angered the board members

definitions: impossible to imagine or comprehend; beyond what can be conceived
examples: The scale of destruction was unimaginable
They suffered unimaginable hardships during the war

definitions: lacking in imagination or creativity; dull and predictable
examples: The unimaginative design failed to impress the clients
His unimaginative solution ignored better alternatives

definitions: not slowed, blocked, or hindered; proceeding without obstruction
examples: The river flowed unimpeded to the sea
Unimpeded access allowed quick emergency response

definitions: lacking significance, value, or consequence; trivial or minor
examples: Don't waste time on unimportant details
She felt unimportant in the large organization

definitions: not feeling admiration or respect; failing to be favorably affected
examples: The critics remained unimpressed by the performance
She seemed unimpressed with his achievements

definitions: failing to evoke admiration or respect; ordinary or mediocre
examples: His unimpressive resume lacked relevant experience
The team's unimpressive performance disappointed fans

definitions: not enhanced, developed, or made better; remaining in original state
examples: The unimproved land remained in its natural state
His condition remained unimproved after treatment

definitions: not formed into a legal corporation; lacking municipal organization
examples: The unincorporated business operated as a partnership
They lived in an unincorporated area outside city limits

definitions: not affected by infection or disease; remaining healthy
examples: The uninfected patients were moved to separate wards
Only uninfected cells showed normal growth patterns

definitions: not having or showing awareness or understanding of facts
examples: The uninformed public believed the false rumors
His uninformed opinion carried little weight

definitions: not suitable or safe for people to live in
examples: The fire left the house completely uninhabitable
Mars remains uninhabitable without life support systems

definitions: having no people living there; empty of human residents
examples: The uninhabited island became a nature reserve
They explored the uninhabited regions of Antarctica

definitions: expressing oneself freely without restraint or social conventions
examples: Her uninhibited laughter filled the entire room
The uninhibited dancers moved with complete freedom

definitions: not harmed physically; escaping without injury or damage
examples: All passengers remained uninjured in the collision
She was uninjured but badly shaken

definitions: lacking in imagination or originality; dull and uninteresting
examples: The uninspired menu offered only basic dishes
His uninspired performance disappointed the audience

definitions: failing to make someone feel enthusiastic or interested
examples: The uninspiring speech failed to motivate the team
Their uninspiring leader lacked vision and charisma

definitions: not covered by insurance; having no insurance protection
examples: Millions of uninsured Americans struggle with healthcare costs
The uninsured driver faced huge liability claims

definitions: showing or having little intelligence; not smart or clever
examples: His unintelligent remarks embarrassed everyone present
The unintelligent design wasted valuable resources
